summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 between FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding discovery requests in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details the status of evidence scanning, including message pads, grand jury transcripts, nude/semi-nude images, and FBI files, with discussions about timelines and logistical challenges.

persons.name: Tony Figuero
persons.context: Mentioned as someone a detective has a scheduled call with, indicating potential coordination on the case.

persons.name: Reiter
persons.context: Individual who provided paper evidence to the FBI, which is part of the discovery materials being discussed.

events.title: Discovery coordination emails
events.description: Series of emails discussing the status of discovery materials for the Maxwell case, including evidence scans, FBI files, and nude image review.

events.title: Discovery summary provided
events.description: FBI provides a summary of discovery items requested, outlining what is ready, what needs more time (specifically nude/semi-nude image review), and offering to coordinate via phone.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI was actively reviewing and removing nude/semi-nude images from seized evidence disks, which was described as a large volume and the most difficult task to complete by the requested deadline.

Discovery materials included scanned message pads (with and without post-it notes), grand jury testimony from the Miami case on a disk, and paper evidence from New York, Virgin Islands, and from Reiter.
There were outstanding requests for search warrant returns for specific warrants (20 mag 6719 and NH premises warrant) and for CART paperwork and 302s related to device data extraction.

The correspondence highlights the logistical challenges and coordination between the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in preparing discovery for the Maxwell prosecution.
